title: List Keeper
description: List Keeper was initially a pre-work submission for CodePath in hopes of participating their Android Bootcamp. I have since expanded the simple todo application to persist template lists for occasional activities like camping. I am currently inspecting firebase and google sheets as a platform to keep the data online; this would open doors for a web-app version.

title: Time Keeper
description: Designed and implemented a web application to keep track of work done. It employed JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, CSS, and BootStrap in the front-end while using PHP and MySQL for the back-end.

title: My Pantry
description: Using Java, I formulated a console-based program to generate a shopping list. The user stores recipes through the program or a file then picks recipes he or she wants to cook. Once the user is done, the program will generate a .txt file containing the shopping list.

title: Wasteless
description: Designed and implemented a simple android application to keep track of perishable food. Food items are manually added and stored at SharedPreference using GSON library. Notifications are sent when the item is within a week of its lifespan

title: Finance
description: Created a simple gui-based java application to keep track of my expenses. It separates it by day, week, month, and year. I used Java Swing to create the GUI and SQLite to store the relational database.
